revised_title: The Structure of Ice in Compressed Zones of Alpine Glaciers
tldr: This study investigates the structure and movement of ice in a compressed zone on the Rhone Glacier. The research focuses on understanding the physics of compressed ice in Alpine glaciers and how it relates to the behavior of disturbed Pleistocene Drift deposits. The findings provide insight into the movement and structure of ice under pressure, which is essential for understanding the behavior of glaciers and their impact on the environment.
